itemDescription: English cricketer, and rugby league footballer (1956-)

wikipedia_page.main: John Crossley (birth registered fourth ¼ 1956), also known by the nickname of "Jay Cee", is an English cricketer, and  professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1970s and 1980s. He played club level cricket for Fairburn Cricket Club, as a wicket-keeper, and club level rugby league (RL) for Wakefield Trinity (Heritage № 842), Castleford (Heritage № 605) (loan), York, Lock Lane ARLFC, Fulham R.L.F.C. (Heritage № 27), Bradford Northern, Halifax (Heritage № 957), and Featherstone Rovers (Heritage № 634), as a wing, stand-off, or scrum-half, i.e. number 2 or 5, 6, or 7.
